ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: During the past three months, how often did you drink alcohol?
Notes: 1 = Every day ; 2 = Four or five days a week ; 3 = Two or three days a week ; 4 = Once a week ; 5 = Two or three days a month ; 6 = About once a month ; 7 = Once or twice in the past 3 months ; 8 = Not at all

ElementDescription: Think of all the times you have had a drink during THE PAST THREE MONTHS. How much did you usually drink each time?
Notes: 8 = Nine or more cans of beer, glasses of wine, or drinks of liquor ; 7 = Seven or eight ; 6 = Six ; 5 = Five ; 4 = Four ; 3 = Three ; 2 = Two ; 1 = One ; 0 = Less than one can of beer, glass of wine, or drink of liquor

ElementDescription: Over the past THREE MONTHS, how many times did you drink five or more drinks (of beer, wine, or liquor) when you were drinking?
Notes: 0 = Never ; 1 = Once ; 2 = Twice ; 3 = Once a month ; 4 = 2 or 3 days a month ; 5 = Once a week ; 6 = Twice a week ; 7 = More than twice a week

ElementDescription: Over the past THREE MONTHS, about how many times have you gotten drunk or "very, very high" on alcohol?
Notes: 0 = Never ; 1 = Once ; 2 = Twice ; 3 = Once a month ; 4 = 2 or 3 days a month ; 5 = Once a week ; 6 = Twice a week ; 7 = More than twice a week
